intro: Jatropha pohliana, commonly known as the Pohli's physic nut, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, red, berry-like fruits that contain toxic seeds. It is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap and diverse ecological roles. Jatropha pohliana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
